New Records: Rilee Rossouw scored the first hundred of the T20 World Cup 2022
Rilee Rossouw became the second player to score back-to-back hundreds in T20Is
Key Match Events: Rossouw and de Kock put on 163 runs, the highest partnership in the history of the T20 World Cup
Rossouw's innings consisted of seven boundaries and eight sixes
Post-Match Reflections: De Kock expressed his happiness at seeing Rossouw back in the Proteas lineup and praised his knock
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa won the toss and elected to bat first in Sydney
The South African innings lost a bit of steam at the end and they ended up scoring 205 runs in their allotted 20 overs for the loss of five wickets
Others: Temba Bavuma was dismissed in the first over for just two runs
Afif Hossain dismissed de Kock for 63 runs from 38 balls
